title: Teenage boy stabbed to death in east London
text:
The boy died at the scene 20 minutes after he was attacked (Picture: PA)

A teenager has been stabbed to death in broad daylight outside a McDonald’s in east London.

Met Police said the boy was knifed outside Stratford Broadway shortly at 3.20pm on Thursday.

Despite paramedics’ best efforts, the teenager was pronounced dead just 20 minutes later.

Formal identification of the victim is due to take place shortly.

A second male was also found stabbed, before being rushed to hospital but his injuries are not thought to be life-threatening.

The teenager died of his injuries just 20 minutes after he was stabbed (Picture: PA)

The area remains closed off (Picture: PA)

A London Ambulance Service spokeswoman said: ‘We treated two teenage boys at the scene. Sadly, despite the efforts of medics, a teenager died at the scene.’

Police said a crime scene is currently in place and that no arrests have yet been made.

Advertisement

Advertisement

A section 60 order, giving officers the power to stop and search in the area, has been implemented following the incident.

A tweet from the Newham branch of the force said: ‘Detectives are investigating after a male teenager was fatally stabbed outside Stratford Broadway at 1520hrs today.

A second boy was stabbed and was rushed to hospital (Picture: PA)

The Centre is currently closed due to an incident and will remain closed until further notice. — Stratford Centre (@stratfordcentre) October 10, 2019

‘Crime scene remains in place. Section 60 now in place’.

Stratford Centre said it was closed until further notice.

Anyone with information to call police on 101 quoting reference 4644/10Oct or Crimestoppers via 0800 555 111.

Got a story for Metro.co.uk? Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at webnews@metro.co.uk. For more stories like this, check our news page.
description: A boy was stabbed to death outside Stratford Broadway, east London, and another was rushed to hospital.
